May 1, 1988: Fiction
THE ICARUS AGENDA, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $19.95.) A
congressman's secret dealings with terrorists may bring him the Presidency - or
death.
ROCK STAR, by Jackie Collins. (Simon & Schuster, $19.95.) The glory and
anguish of three rock-and- roll performers in tinselly southern California.
THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$19.95.) A bond trader caught in the jungles of New York.
LOVE IN THE TIME OF CHOLERA, by Gabriel Garcia Marquez. (Knopf, $18.95.)
A Colombian poet's perdurable love for a woman is tested by life's changing
conditions.
TREASURE, by Clive Cussler. (Simon & Schuster, $18.95.) Dirk Pitt leads a
global pursuit of hijackers of an ancient Egyptian literary trove.
INHERITANCE, by Judith Michael. (Poseidon, $18.95.) A woman finds herself
enmeshed in the jealousies and conspiracies of a wealthy family on Boston's
Beacon Hill.
THE LAST PRINCESS, by Cynthia Freeman. (Putnam, $18.95.) What ensues
when a New York socialite sacrifices a family fortune and a wealthy fianc√© to
marry for love.
HOT MONEY, by Dick Francis. (Putnam, $17.95.) Which member of a gold
arbitrager's family was responsible for the murder of his fifth wife?
THE SHELL SEEKERS, by Rosamunde Pilcher. (St. Martin's, $19.95.) A woman
and a painting tie together three generations of an English family.
KING OF THE MURGOS, by David Eddings. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $16.95.) Book
Two of the fantasy saga that began with ''Guardians of the West.''
BELOVED, by Toni Morrison. (Knopf, $18.95.) Memories of her past haunt an
escaped slave in post-Civil War Ohio.
EMPEROR OF THE AIR, by Ethan Canin. (Houghton Mifflin, $15.95.) Nine short
stories about a variety of characters and situations.
THE MYSTERIES OF PITTSBURGH, by Michael Chabon. (Morrow, $16.95.) An
eye-opening summer for a young man just graduated from college.
THE TOMMYKNOCKERS, by Stephen King. (Putnam, $19.95.) Two writers'
zealous attempt to unearth mysterious artifacts creates nightmares in a Maine
village.
Non-Fiction
LOVE, MEDICINE & MIRACLES, by Bernie S. Siegel. (Harper & Row, $17.95.) A
surgeon stresses the importance of the patient's mind and emotions.
A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, by Stephen W. Hawking. (Bantam, $18.95.) A
scientist's review of efforts to create a unified theory of the universe.
TRUMP, by Donald J. Trump with Tony Schwartz. (Random House, $19.95.) An
entrepreneur's career.
WASHINGTON GOES TO WAR, by David Brinkley. (Knopf, $18.95.) A social and
political portrait of the nation's capital during World War II.
CITIZEN COHN, by Nicholas von Hoffman. (Doubleday, $19.95.) The life of Roy
M. Cohn.
THE RISE AND FALL OF THE GREAT POWERS, by Paul Kennedy. (Random
House, $24.95.) The fortunes of great nations.
THRIVING ON CHAOS, by Tom Peters. (Knopf, $19.95.) How companies can
survive.
BATTLE CRY OF FREEDOM, by James M. McPherson. (Oxford University, $30.)
A history of the American Civil War era.
WINFIELD, by Dave Winfield with Tom Parker. (Norton, $16.95.) The outfielder's
autobiography.
CHAOS, by James Gleick. (Viking, $19.95.) An account of a fast-developing new
science.
THE TRIAL OF SOCRATES, by I. F. Stone. (Little, Brown, $18.95.) The
philosopher's life and death.
THE POWER GAME, by Hedrick Smith. (Random House, $22.50.) How the
Federal Government has evolved over the past 15 years.
UNDER THE EYE OF THE CLOCK, by Christopher Nolan. (St. Martin's, $16.95.)
The autobiography of a paralyzed young Irish writer.
THE PRIZE PULITZER, by Roxanne Pulitzer with Kathleen Maxa. (Villard,
$17.95.) Life in Palm Beach's steamy rich society.
SPEAKING OUT, by Larry Speakes with Robert Pack. (Scribners, $19.95.) The
experiences of President Reagan's former spokesman.
1999, by Richard Nixon. (Simon & Schuster, $19.95.) The former President
outlines a program to assure the survival of the United States.
